snippet.textDisplay: love Suikoden 2 last year my mum had a small stroke (she is fine) but while she recovered, she wanted something to do with her hands so I gave her my psp with Suikoden 1 and 2 once I explained how you play a jrpg she really enjoyed them watching my old mum experience the same games I loved as a kid is really satisfying
snippet.textOriginal: love Suikoden 2 last year my mum had a small stroke (she is fine) but while she recovered, she wanted something to do with her hands so I gave her my psp with Suikoden 1 and 2 once I explained how you play a jrpg she really enjoyed them watching my old mum experience the same games I loved as a kid is really satisfying

snippet.textDisplay: V was a pretty great game, but unfortunately Konami ditched the series creator after Suikoden III, and although they eventually asked him back to finish up the series' epic plot he said it was impossible given the deviations from his plan that were done in Suiko IV and V (Basically there was too much ground to cover for one game).  Would have loved to see that final battle against the power of the Circle Rune, but alas it will never come to pass...
snippet.textOriginal: V was a pretty great game, but unfortunately Konami ditched the series creator after Suikoden III, and although they eventually asked him back to finish up the series' epic plot he said it was impossible given the deviations from his plan that were done in Suiko IV and V (Basically there was too much ground to cover for one game).  Would have loved to see that final battle against the power of the Circle Rune, but alas it will never come to pass...

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky Honestly, if you're a fan of 1 and 2 I wouldn't bother with the newer titles. They, in my opinion, ruined the Suikoden series. 3 and 5 were....meh.Stick with 1 and 2 if you want the best Suikoden experience! ---->Biggest Suikoden fan evah! lol Suikoden 2 has yet to be released on PSN but if you can find a PS1 emulator and download the ROM you could still play it without having to fork over the $200 bux for the actual game.

snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky Wow, you were so lucky to get it then. These days it is pretty expensive. But it is a great game and this is a great music. Really, no questions here. 

And you definitely should try Suikoden IV and V. Those are amazing games. IV not so much, but it isn't bad, only the main character looks weird. The V is actually pretty good and many say that it gets close the II as much as possible.

snippet.textDisplay: Amazing game. I've finished it a few times by now. One of my favourite games definetly. I've played a bit of Suikoden 5 and like it. snippet.textDisplay:
Lovely theme, quite emotional. I still need to play Suikoden IV and V. I've heard bad things about the former and good things about the other one.

I was pretty lucky with this game, I bought it used but in perfect mint condition for 10 dollars back in 2000 or so. Now it's a pretty rare and expensive game. Was it released on PSN? I know the first was.
